meanings.definition: Inform on someone to the police.
meanings.sent1: I will dob on my friend if they break the rules.
meanings.sent2: She decided to dob in the criminal to the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel dobbed on the sneaky raccoon stealing nuts.
meanings.sent4: The witness dobbed on the suspect, leading to their arrest.
meanings.sent5: Dobbing on the culprit helped solve the mystery quickly.

meanings.definition: Strike someone with a heavy blow.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally dobs his brother while playing.
meanings.sent2: The boxer aims to dob his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: The pillow fight escalated when she tried to dob her friend too hard.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds dobbed the trees, causing damage.
meanings.sent5: The hammer dobs the nail firmly into the wood.

meanings.definition: A small lump or piece of something.
meanings.sent1: She found a dob of clay on the pottery wheel.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a dob of butter to the sizzling pan.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten chased after the dob of yarn.
meanings.sent4: A dob of paint fell from the artist's brush onto the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The baker placed a dob of frosting on top of the cupcake.
